result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas John Imker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas John Imker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas John Imker was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Thomas John Imker in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads No Contest to Ct #1.   Found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld.  DEF is placed on 2 years probation.  $979 fine/costs, including DNA surcharge and DNA sample by DOC.  Any counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC.   DEF to report to probation by end of business day Monday 11-23-15.
